shortdef: the practice of agriculture or aquaculture

dt: {bc}to collect and take the fees or profits of (an occupation or business) on payment of a fixed sum
{bc}to give up (something, such as an estate or a business) to another on condition of receiving in return a fixed sum
{bc}to manage and cultivate as a farm
{bc}to engage in raising crops or animals

shortdef: to collect and take the fees or profits of (an occupation or business) on payment of a fixed sum
to give up (something, such as an estate or a business) to another on condition of receiving in return a fixed sum

dt: {bc}farming on nonirrigated land with little rainfall that relies on moisture-conserving tillage and drought-resistant crops

shortdef: farming on nonirrigated land with little rainfall that relies on moisture-conserving tillage and drought-resistant crops

dt: {bc}the growing of food or cash crops, feed crops, and livestock on the same farm

shortdef: the growing of food or cash crops, feed crops, and livestock on the same farm

dt: {bc}farming or a system of farming that provides all or almost all the goods required by the farm family usually without any significant surplus for sale
{bc}farming or a system of farming that produces a minimum and often inadequate return to the farmer

shortdef: farming or a system of farming that provides all or almost all the goods required by the farm family usually without any significant surplus for sale
farming or a system of farming that produces a minimum and often inadequate return to the farmer —called also subsistence agriculture

dt: {bc}a farm on which large numbers of livestock are raised indoors in conditions intended to maximize production at minimal cost

shortdef: a large industrialized farm; especially : a farm on which large numbers of livestock are raised indoors in conditions intended to maximize production at minimal cost

dt: {bc}to turn over for performance by another usually under contract
{bc}to put (someone, such as a child) into the hands of another for care
{bc}to send (an athlete, such as a baseball player) to a farm team
{bc}to exhaust (land) by farming especially by continuously raising one crop

shortdef: to turn over for performance by another usually under contract
to put (someone, such as a child) into the hands of another for care
to send (an athlete, such as a baseball player) to a farm team

dt: {bc}a commercial facility for raising aquatic animals for human food

shortdef: a commercial facility for raising aquatic animals for human food
not of or relating to farms or farming
